meanings.definition: Resembling or having the form of something else.
meanings.sent1: The pseudomorphic clouds looked like fluffy cotton candy in the sky.
meanings.sent2: Her pseudomorphic hairstyle was identical to the one her favorite celebrity wore.
meanings.sent3: The pseudomorphic shadows on the wall seemed to dance in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: The artist created a pseudomorphic painting that mimicked the style of a famous master.
meanings.sent5: The garden gnome had a pseudomorphic grin that matched the one on the old man's face.

meanings.definition: Having a similar structure or appearance to something else.
meanings.sent1: The pseudomorphic crystals in the cave sparkled like diamonds.
meanings.sent2: The new building had a pseudomorphic design to the one across the street.
meanings.sent3: The pseudomorphic cupcakes at the party fooled everyone into thinking they were real.
meanings.sent4: Her pseudomorphic handwriting was so similar to her sister's that they often mixed up their notes.
meanings.sent5: The actor's pseudomorphic performance perfectly imitated the mannerisms of the famous character.
